intro: Urostigma catalpifolium, commonly known as the catalpa-leaved urostigma, is a member of the Malvaceae family. It is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of eastern North America. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves, which resemble those of the catalpa tree, giving it its common name. It produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink to purple in color. Urostigma catalpifolium is often found in moist, wooded areas and is known for its ornamental value in gardens.
